qas.question: What did Jesus do before he was arrested?
How many Apostles were there at the Last Supper?
How was Jesus tortured before he was crucified?
What was placed on Jesus' head?
What city was the Sanhedrin located in?
Who appointed the Sanhedrin to office to form a judicial body?
In front of what judicial body did the twelve apostles stand trial?
What group handed the twelve apostles over for crucifixion?
What was a punishment given to the twelve apostles?

context: Combining statements in the canonical Gospels produces the following account: Jesus was arrested in <a0_0>Gethsemane<a0_0/> following <a1_0>the Last Supper<a1_0/> with the <a2_0>Twelve Apostles<a2_0/>, and then stood trial before the <b7_0>Sanhedrin<b7_0/> (a Jewish judicial body), Pontius Pilate (a Roman authority in <b5_0>Judaea<b5_0/>), and Herod Antipas (king of Judea, appointed by <b6_0>Rome<b6_0/>), before being handed over for crucifixion by <b8_0>the chief priests<b8_0/> of the Jews. After being <a3_0><b9_0>flogged<b9_0/><a3_0/>, Jesus was mocked by Roman soldiers as the "King of the Jews", clothed in a purple robe, <a4_0>crowned with thorns<a4_0/>, beaten and spat on. Jesus then had to make his way to the place of his crucifixion.
